a

> Having a home can be enough.

> Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New  to the list
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/1/01 7:13:14 PM, e.a.hupe@worldnet.att.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/1/01 7:13:14 PM, e.a.hupe@... writes:

<< 3 years "new" to teaching
at home . . . yet I feel somehow I am
being negligent as a parent >>

If you can change the language and definitions so you're thinking of it as
enabling them to learn at home instead of "teaching" them, that will help a
lot all by itself.

With five kids all small, you have no room in your house for a "school"!
Having a home can be enough.

Welcome! If you haven't already checked out www.unschooling.com, please do!

Sandra





Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd

messages.subject: New  to the list
messages.msgSnippet: Hello: I am a new mmember of the list, and 3 years new to teaching at home. I am in a total state of nerves! My heart tells me what I am doing is right yet
messages.messageBody:
Hello: I am a new mmember of the list, and 3 years "new" to teaching
at home. I am in a total state of nerves! My heart tells me what I am
doing is right yet so many people seem to tell me what I am doing
will not work. I have 5 children 8,6,4,2,1. Ever since they were born
I have let my heart lead the way. With breastfeeding, sleeping
raising, everything. I knew our "school" would be like that as well.
I am so glad to have found this place to share ideas and thoughts
with like minded people. I love to watch the freedom of my children
in play, not laboring over their workbooks, yet I feel somehow I am
being negligent as a parent. Thank You for this place and your kind
ears.
Emily
